* Zyber watched the beast gulp down yet another cup of that strong tea, 
still amazed at how he could do that.
She watched him look back at her, wondering just what it could be that he 
was thinking about. But then again, it really didn't matter.
She listened as he gave his name, it actually turning out to be one that was 
just as much a common name as the rest she heard of.
But she managed to put up a small yet friendly smile.*

" Zyber."

* She simply clasped her hands on her knees, waiting to see the beasts 
reaction. And hoping that simply giving her name like he asked wouldn't 
anger him to the point of her jumping back.
Besides, it was about time that he rested.
Zyber got to her feet and looked around the room, seeing nothing that needed 
to be tended to she simply turned back towards the damaged bot.
She still had one thing to do though, before she went about her normal days 
work.
Zyber picked up the rock jar of salve and faced the creature.
She kneeled down beside the bed and took a bit of the salve onto her 
fingers, and without a moment's hesitation she began to apply a fair coat of 
it onto the beasts chest.
This would make sure that he didn't stop breathing or anything while she was 
busy with other things.*
